snippet: President Obama’s determination to train moderate rebels in the battle against ISIS leaves the U.S. dependent on a diverse group riven by infighting.
abstract: Pres Obama’s determination to train Syrian rebels to serve as ground troops against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria leaves United States dependent on a diverse group riven by infighting, with no shared leadership and with hard-line Islamists as its most effective fighters; analysts say concept of Free Syrian Army as unified force with effective command structure is a myth.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD, ERIC SCHMITT and MARK MAZZETTI
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Beirut, and Eric Schmitt and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s determination to train moderate rebels in the battle against ISIS leaves the U.S. dependent on a diverse group riven by infighting.

headline.main: U.S. Pins Hope on Syrian Rebels With Loyalties All Over the Map
headline.print_headline: U.S. Pins Hope on Syrian Rebels With Loyalties All Over the Map

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
